alert.note: Alert for Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 8:49AM MST until March 05 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW PRODUCING AREAS OF SLICK ROADS... .An area of snow showers will move across the northeast Colorado plains this morning, with most of the showers passing between Sterling and Akron and the northeast corner and another area of accumulating snow over northern Larimer county. Light snow showers will also continue over the northern Colorado mountains today. The showers on the plains will diminish from west to east this afternoon. Snow will increase in the mountains overnight, with another round of mainly light snow on the plains during the day Sunday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Accumulations today of up to 3 inches, heaviest north of the Poudre Canyon. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills. * WHEN...Until Noon MST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
